Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Reverend Dr. Gardner C. Taylor, Concord Baptist Church, Brooklyn, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER ROBINSON.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Dr. Gardner C. Taylor, Concord Baptist Church, Brooklyn, New York.

Council Member Robimnson moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of  the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Borough President of Staten Island of JOHN MEROLO as a member of the City Planning Commission

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred to on July 27, 2000, respectfully,

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Staten Island Borough President of JOHN MEROLO as a member of the City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2001.

Res. No. 1520

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE STATEN ISLAND BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF JOHN MEROLO AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman:

RESOLVED, that purusnat to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Staten Island Borough President of JOHN MEROLO, as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 200l.

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment  by the Borough President of  the Bronx of  KENNETH KNUCKLES as a member of the City Planning Commission


The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred to on July 27, 2000, respectfully,

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Bronx Borough President of KENNETH KNUCKLES as a member of the City Planning Commission, for a term beginning July 1, 2000 and which will expire on June 30, 2005.  

Res. No. 1519

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE BRONX BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF KENNETH KNUCKLES AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman:

RESOLVED,that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Bronx Borough President of KENNETH KNUCKLES, as a member of the City Planning Commission, for a term beginning July 1, 2000 and which will expire on June 30, 2005.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to provision of a retirement incentive for certain employees of the city of New York.

Resolution authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for municipal park projects, local waterfront revitalization projects, and a Hudson River Valley Greenway project within the City of New York and the signing of associated state contracts under the appropriate laws of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Filing of applications for state assistance payments.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to Section 19-511.1 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York to review 14 determinations by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve applications for the renewal of a license to operate a base station and to review one determination by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve an application for a license to operate a new base station.

Resolution calling upon the Agency for Child Development (ACD) to allow families with incomes that exceed 1990's income ceilings to be entitled to remain enrolled for benefits until ACD puts an updated fee scale into effect, provided that the family income does not exceed this year's Title XX income ceilings, and to stop imposing child care fees on parents with incomes below the current poverty level.

Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and Governor to amend the Real Property Tax Law to add disabled heads of households to those eligible for the Senior Citizens Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE).
A Local Law in relation to a street name, La Lupe Way, Borough of The Bronx.
